item.value: By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billion telephone lines in the world.
Atari releases Pong, the first commercial video game on November 29, 1972.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish.
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion) people.
The 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics was won by Albert Einstein for his work in the field of theoretical physics.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.

The original Olympic Games were a series of athletic competitions held in Ancient Greece. In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
Mount McKinley in Alaska is the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high. Alaska is also the largest state in America, it is 656,425 square miles in size.
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
In 1932 Amelia Earhart became the first woman to do a solo transatlantic flight. She flew from Harbor Grace, Newfoundland, to Ireland in approximately 15 hr.
If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
The Sun is one of about 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The most current estimates guess that there are 100 to 200 billion galaxies in the Universe
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
The Sputnik 1, launched on October 4, 1957 by Russia, was the first human-made object to orbit the Earth.
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
Light travels slower through different substances such as glass, water and air.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
Tides are caused by the rotation of the Earth and the gravitational effects of the Moon and Sun.
